reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Entertaining mystery listening 🎶🔰
reviews.reviewText: I have been reading 👓 or listening 🎶 to Stuart Woods Stone Barrington books 📚 since 2010. I have enjoyed each story as Stone Barrington has changed from a struggling lawyer to a multimillion heir. This novel continues with Lance Cabot calling with a CIA mission for Stone. He is off to the UK with an unknown person and the fun begins. It is a woman 🚺 whose husband is trying too kill her. From the UK to New York City to Maine back to New York City to 🔑 West back to New York City to Connecticut and back to New York City where it all ends. I would highly recommend this series and author to 👍 readers of action mystery novels 👍🔰. Enjoy the adventure of reading 👓 or listening 🎶 to Alexa read books 📚. 2023 😀👒🏡😯Stuart Woods is one of my all time favorite authors. Happy reading and have fun 🌙

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Another fine mess for Stone & company
reviews.reviewText: These novels are a special treasure that I'm fortunate to be able to enjoy, my guilty pleasure so to speak. It begins with Stone and Dino being drafted by Lance Cabot to provide protection and safe haven for a congressional witness; who they don't even get to meet until they have left New York airspace on the way to England. This is a delightful romp with our heroes jetting from New York City to the south of England, and from Maine to Florida attempting to safeguard the former wife of a crooked senator and his henchman. These books are pure fun and an enjoyable experience, I look forward to each new one like it's my birthday, I'm excited for it to come but then it's over too quickly. I know there will be another book after a time and that makes it alright. Stone won't save the world or teach us any meaningful life lessons but he is great company for a long afternoon or a lazy weekend. I recommend these titles wholeheartedly, at least until Stone starts chasing ambulances, but knowing Stuart Woods, he'd find a way to make it an interesting read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stone Barrington novel.
reviews.reviewText: I have not read this yet but I am a long time fan of Stuart Woods.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Consistent with rest of series.
reviews.reviewText: A quick read, the usual fun banter, but the female lead is totally unsympathetic! Have read and will continue to read this series but only when cheaper prices!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I donated to lions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love Stewart Woods!
reviews.reviewText: During the pandemic lockdown I lived vicariously thru Stewart Woods books. They kept me sane. Stone Barrington travels the world on his planes , has amazing homes, eats fabulous food and drinks the best wines. The books are so descriptive you feel like you are there. I have read every book and looked forward to each new one. I was so devastated to learn of his death. You will love his books!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Total Rush Job… Lowest Quality Writing… Stuart Woods and Putnam should be embarrassed
reviews.reviewText: I love these Stone Barrington books. Never a literary masterpiece, they are, however a great escape/mind candy. This one was so bad I couldn’t enjoy it. Did this get written and edited in a weekend?The quality of Safe House was so poor that I couldn’t enjoy it. It reads like a first draft, not a published work. For example, in the final chapters of the book there are so many holes in the plot (the Senator somehow avoids any police inquiry) , so many loops left open (where did all the security people go?), and so many lazy head scratchers (in Connecticut, they go to a restaurant and have no idea where other team members have gone), that I felt insulted, stupid for paying for this book.One thing Woods does well in this book is continue to reinforce his outdated prejudice and hatred towards Republicans, Christians and conservative media by reinforcing outdated stereotypes. The way he portrays these elements is offensive… to one’s intellect. Stuart must live in an echo chamber. In the past I’ve tolerated this indulgence. Now I’m just tired of his lack of imagination.It feels sad to say this, but is the last Stone Barrington book I will have ever purchased. I wish I could get back my $15 and 3+ hours of reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2022
reviews.reviewText: If you're looking for a book you can read in a day then Stuart Woods' Stone Barrington series are the books for you. I've enjoyed the character of Stone since the beginning. However, I think it's high time Stone showed some restraint and did not bed every damsel in distress he meets. Not a book has gone by he hasn't slept with 2-3-4 women. In one book. That's getting very tiring. I'm surprised he hasn't caught a venereal disease.

reviews.reviewTitle: Woods continues to engage as Stone ages
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoyed seeing some pretty imaginative problem solving and a rare display of bad temper from lawyer Barrington and his new lady friend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good writer. Read all his books. Easy read.

reviews.reviewText: I like everything written by Stuart Woods

reviews.reviewTitle: disturbing; repetitive; but has its moments
reviews.reviewText: I have, over the years, since reading New York Dead, enjoyed the Stone Barrington series, for the most part ... especially so the earlier tales ... so I tend to approach each new release with some eagerness. This one had its moments ... I did enjoy another visit to the English manor house, for instance, but I discovered myself having less and less sympathy for the "victim" as the tale unfolded, and at one point even thought that Woods was attempting (unsuccessfully) to create a character with an alter-ego, given that her later actions did not match her earlier ones. I lost that necessary ingredient of any sympathy for the "wronged" character, and thus had nothing left to invest in the outcome. I still like Stone Barrington as a character and trust that Woods will offer a more accessible tale in his next effort. I give it two stars because Stone Barrington has a few good moments, but overall, this tale was disappointing.

This book is Amazing! It has twists & turns all through the book! Stuart Woods never disappoints. I totally addicted to his books! I can not write another one soon enough! I would recommend this book!
